page.title: 15BALLINDEAN HOUSE ABERNYTE
page.content: Ballindean House is a large Georgian house at the foot of the southern slopes of the braes of the Carse of Gowrie.It has lovely grounds with mature trees that make the grounds exciting to play in.There is an artificial lake 400 metres in front of the house.For many years a doctor from Dundee lived in the house and it was known as Surgeon Campbell's House.It was empty for 16 years.In 1984 a Christian Trust bought it.It is now being repaired and will become a young persons activity camp,called Teen Ranch.By 1985 six rooms had been fixed they had to strip the plaster,rewire, paint and tidy up the grounds.It is to be partly opened in the summer of 1985 By 1986 they hope there will be activities like Rugby,Canoeing,Table Tennis,Volley ball,Netball and Bible study.
